docs.snippet: OAS stand formally backed by Uruguay
docs.abstract: OAS stand formally backed by Uruguay

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 24--At least six Latin-American countries offered military assistance to the United States today. The response followed yesterday's recommendation by the Organization of American States to authorize a quarantine of Cuba.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 24--At least six Latin-American countries offered military assistance to the United States today. The response followed yesterday's recommendation by the Organization of American States to authorize a quarantine of Cuba.
docs.abstract: 6 Latin-Amer nations offer to aid US blockade; Argentina offers naval units; others offer bases; Amb Morrison (US) warns OAS Council not to lose sight of subversion danger; Mex, Brazil object to some proposed means of countering subversion by Cuba

headline.main: Six Latin Countries Offer Military Aid To U.S. in Blockade; Six Latin-American Countries Offer Military Help to the U.S. for Use in Blockade

byline.original: By TAD SZULC Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26--The United States was said tonight to be interpreting action by the Organization of American States Tuesday as clear authority to use force in dismantling missile bases in Cuba.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26--The United States was said tonight to be interpreting action by the Organization of American States Tuesday as clear authority to use force in dismantling missile bases in Cuba.

headline.main: U.S. THINKS LATINS SANCTION FORCE; Sees O.A.S. Vote as Giving Right to Dismantle Bases U.S. Interprets O.A.S. Vote as Sanctioning Force Against Bases LATIN AIDE BACKS WASHINGTON VIEW Mora Asserts Move on Cuba Missile Sites Would Be a Multilateral Step.

docs.snippet: The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (World Bank) made a 15-year, 5 per cent loan equivalent to $18,500,000 to Uruguay yesterday. The loan will be used to rebuild to allweather standards the country's main north-south trunk...
docs.lead_paragraph: The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (World Bank) made a 15-year, 5 per cent loan equivalent to $18,500,000 to Uruguay yesterday. The loan will be used to rebuild to allweather standards the country's main north-south trunk highway.

headline.main: Uruguay Highway Loan Granted by World Bank

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 27 --President Joan-Goulart's lead ing foreign policy adviser proposed today that Cuba be neutralized and yield all her nuclear weapons in exchange for a nonaggression pledge from the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 27 --President Joan-Goulart's lead ing foreign policy adviser proposed today that Cuba be neutralized and yield all her nuclear weapons in exchange for a nonaggression pledge from the United States.
docs.abstract: Brazilian ex-Min Dantas proposes that Cuba give up all nuclear weapons in exch for US nonaggression pledge; also would require Cuba to be neutralized and to pledge not to try to subvert neighbors; defends Brazil's vote in OAS

headline.main: CUBA COMPROMISE URGED IN BRAZIL; Ban on Atom Weapons and Aggression Proposed

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times
